home.about_description: Vihara Avalokitesvara Pondok Cabe is a Buddhayana temple under the Sangha Agung Indonesia, serving the community since the early 1980s. Located on Jalan Pondok Cabe Raya in Pamulang, South Tangerang, it hosts weekly Sunday services, meditation sessions, and programmes for the youth (PMV) and children (GABI).

profile.title: Profile, Vision & Mission
profile.description: Vihara Avalokitesvara is a place for spiritual cultivation and service—where the community learns the Dhamma, practises virtue, and strengthens harmony in a calm and orderly atmosphere.
profile.vision_text: To be a temple that nurtures wisdom, compassion, and harmony—serving as a welcoming centre for Dhamma education and community growth.
mission_items: Conduct regular services, meditation sessions, and Dhamma learning.
Encourage character development, discipline, and social care within the community.
Provide engaging learning spaces for children (GABI) and youth (PMV).
Cultivate a culture of service (seva) through committees and social programmes.

timeline.text: The community began organising simple worship and Dhamma learning activities, gradually growing as the need for a dedicated place of practice increased.
Regular programmes became more structured; youth (PMV) and children (GABI) initiatives were strengthened to support long-term cultivation.
The temple continues to serve through religious activities, Dhamma education, and community service—grounded in harmony and consistency.

pmv.desc_full: PMV is the vihara youth association focused on Dhamma learning, character and leadership development, and service through temple committees and social activities.

gabi.desc_full: GABI is the Sunday School programme for Buddhist children at the vihara. Children learn Buddhist values in a fun way through Dhamma stories, simple chanting, educational games, and creative activities.
